title: Android Weekly Issue #649
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored Add paywalls in one line of code Take the pain out of configuring and testing your app's paywalls. With RevenueCat Paywalls you can remotely configure and edit your entire paywall view without waiting on App Review. StateFlow vs MutableState State management is a crucial part of Android, and Kai Cilliers takes a look at two options. The best dispatcher for a backend framework Marcin Moskała analyzes which dispatcher is the best choice for a backend applications. Mix Compose Multiplatform with native iOS UI Gabriel Souza shows how the new Compose Swift Bridge simplifies mixing Compose Multiplatform with native iOS UI. Android Interview Series 2024 — Part 1 — Android basics Anitaa Murthy's revamped series of Android interview questions, broken down into 8 separate articles by areas of interest. Collapsing Toolbar in Compose— PART 2 In part 2, Karishma Agrawal builds a dynamic UI with a collapsing toolbar and shows how to handle nested scrolling effectively. Enhancing AI Powered Developer Tools with Gemini API Read about Sublayer's story which showcases the transformative potential of the Gemini API. A Curious Case of Mistaken Identity: How Lambdas Break Data Class Hashing Matt McKenna tells the tale of the unstable hash that is a warning to all! A Smoother Ride: Android Emulator Stability and Performance Updates All about a Google initiative made up of several workstreams aimed at reducing crashes, speeding up startup time, closing out bugs, and setting up better ways to detect and prevent issues in the future. Not a Phase - Text with Compose and Canvas Eevis Panula looks at how to add text to Canvas and position and animate it, while also utilizing custom Google Fonts in the drawing. Skipping the invocation of intermediate composables Shreyas Patil walks through the concept of using lambdas in the composition scope and how they can be helpful in certain situations. A Developer’s Roadmap to Mastering Kotlin Multiplatform Jaewoong Eum explores the Kotlin Multiplatform (KMP) ecosystem using the Kotlin Multiplatform Developer Roadmap as a guide. A Micro-optimization You Will Never Need Romain Guy shows a micro-optimization more for the fun of it than for its real impact. Place a sponsored post Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! Jobs Staff Android Software Engineer - Native SDKs (Remote (US)) We're seeking a Staff Android Engineer to redefine how observability data is collected and consumed. You’ll lead the development of innovative SDKs and libraries to create seamless and high-performance products. Join us to revolutionize mobile observability! Libraries & Code ComposableScreens A collection of impressive designs built with Compose UI Toolkit News Introducing Native Integrations for Gravatar Mobile SDK Gravatar announced the release of native integrations for the Gravatar Mobile SDK, now available for both Android and iOS. Videos & Podcasts Fun with Function Types in Kotlin Dave Leeds looks at the different kinds of function types in Kotlin to see how we can call regular functions - and even property setters - as if they were extension functions. Accessing Camera in Kotlin Multiplatform (KMP) Abdul Basit covers how we can use Camera on Android and iOS with Compose Multiplatform. Firework: Introducing Compose Hot Reload Sebastian Sellmair documents the journey of building "Compose Hot Reload" in the upcoming videos, demoing the current state and briefly introducing the project. Previewing the Unpreviewable - Placeholder Previews in Compose Philipp Lackner teaches how you can let AsyncImages, video views and other complex composables show up in your Compose preview. Kotlin Symbol Processing Made Easy: Part 2 Welcome to Part 2 of the Kotlin Symbol Processing (KSP) series and dive deeper into advanced techniques to enhance your annotation processors. Ultra HDR images | Android Build Time Tune in to hear from the team at Google Drive and the Android platform team about new capabilities in Ultra HDR. From Sprite Sheets to Stunning Animations in Jetpack Compose! KMP Library From Sprite Sheets to Stunning Animations in Jetpack Compose! KMP Library Listen To Lifecycle Events In Jetpack Compose Daniel Atitienei shows how to listen to lifecycle events in Jetpack Compose. Graphics layers | Jetpack Compose Tips Rebecca Franks teaches all about Graphics Layers in Compose and how you can use the APIs to composite graphics layers together to create interesting visual effects. DevFest 2024 Playlist of all the presentations from DevFest Montreal 2024 There's a new king in DI town Kaushik explores the evolution of dependency injection (DI) in Android development and chats with dependency injection expert Ralf Wondratschek for a final gut check. Kotlin Compiler - Swift Intermediate Representation (SIR) Mohit examines Swift Intermediate Representation and shares concrete examples of Swift and its SIR tree.
text: Take the pain out of configuring and testing your app's paywalls. With RevenueCat Paywalls you can remotely configure and edit your entire paywall view without waiting on App Review. We're seeking a Staff Android Engineer to redefine how observability data is collected and consumed. You’ll lead the development of innovative SDKs and libraries to create seamless and high-performance products. Join us to revolutionize mobile observability! Dave Leeds looks at the different kinds of function types in Kotlin to see how we can call regular functions - and even property setters - as if they were extension functions. Sebastian Sellmair documents the journey of building "Compose Hot Reload" in the upcoming videos, demoing the current state and briefly introducing the project. Rebecca Franks teaches all about Graphics Layers in Compose and how you can use the APIs to composite graphics layers together to create interesting visual effects. html:
Take the pain out of configuring and testing your app's paywalls. With RevenueCat Paywalls you can remotely configure and edit your entire paywall view without waiting on App Review.

We're seeking a Staff Android Engineer to redefine how observability data is collected and consumed. You’ll lead the development of innovative SDKs and libraries to create seamless and high-performance products. Join us to revolutionize mobile observability!

Dave Leeds looks at the different kinds of function types in Kotlin to see how we can call regular functions - and even property setters - as if they were extension functions.

Sebastian Sellmair documents the journey of building "Compose Hot Reload" in the upcoming videos, demoing the current state and briefly introducing the project.

Rebecca Franks teaches all about Graphics Layers in Compose and how you can use the APIs to composite graphics layers together to create interesting visual effects.

Playlist of all the presentations from DevFest Montreal 2024

Kaushik explores the evolution of dependency injection (DI) in Android development and chats with dependency injection expert Ralf Wondratschek for a final gut check.

]]>
